title: Emotion and Memory: Why You Remember What You Feel
description: A fast breakdown of Emotion and Memory: Why You Remember What You Feel for builders.

hook.text: You remember where you were on 9/11 but not what you had for lunch last Tuesday.

buildup.text: Emotional events trigger the amygdala, which signals the hippocampus: 'This matters. Save it.'

discovery.text: Adrenaline and cortisol enhance memory encoding for emotionally charged experiences.
